title: Huge 2,000-Year-Old Elite Artifact Hoard Unearthed in Yorkshire
description: A huge and exceptionally valuable Iron Age hoard, discovered in a Yorkshire field, is offering archaeologists fresh insights about the distribution of wealth and power in northern Britain in the first century AD.The impressive cache of ancient artifacts has been dubbed the Melsonby Hoard, after the nearby village of Melsonby in North Yorkshire where these treasures were found. Among the artifacts included in the hoard are remnants of wagons, ceremonial spears, and pony harnesses, which were all items that would have belonged to wealthy and powerful elites living in this part of Britain nearly 2,000 years ago.While the collection was ultimately excavated and salvaged by archaeologists from Durham University, it was an amateur metal detectorist, Peter Heads, who first discovered the hoard in 2021, in the bottom of a pair of adjacent ditches. The collection of artifacts was simply massive, which suggested to the experts that it was all buried deliberately in a ceremony or observance that must have had profound meaning to the people living in that era. Notably, many of the items seem to have been deliberately broken or burned before burial, making it clear that their was a ceremonial aspect involved in their disposal.Read moreSection: ArtifactsOther ArtifactsNewsHistory & ArchaeologyRead Later
title_translated: Huge 2,000-Year-Old Elite Artifact Hoard Unearthed in Yorkshire

Among the artifacts included in the hoard are remnants of wagons, ceremonial spears, and pony harnesses, which were all items that would have belonged to wealthy and powerful elites living in this part of Britain nearly 2,000 years ago.While the collection was ultimately excavated and salvaged by archaeologists from Durham University, it was an amateur metal detectorist, Peter Heads, who first discovered the hoard in 2021, in the bottom of a pair of adjacent ditches. The collection of artifacts was simply massive, which suggested to the experts that it was all buried deliberately in a ceremony or observance that must have had profound meaning to the people living in that era. Notably, many of the items seem to have been deliberately broken or burned before burial, making it clear that their was a ceremonial aspect involved in their disposal.Read moreSection: ArtifactsOther ArtifactsNewsHistory

title: Trump’s show of support for Conor McGregor is making fertile ground for Ireland’s far right | Justine McCarthy
description: The fighter won’t be Irish president any time soon, but the Trumpocracy seems to think it can shift the country’s politics by endorsing himMiddle Ireland feels grievously insulted by the US president. On St Patrick’s Day, when the globe traditionally turns green, Donald Trump’s official guest at the White House was not the taoiseach bearing a bowl of shamrock, but an unelected stooge recently found by a civil court jury liable for the rape of a woman in a Dublin hotel. Fear and loathing of the mixed martial arts fighter Conor McGregor, who is facing civil trial in the US for alleged sexual assault of another woman in Florida, is one of middle Ireland’s most unifying forces.“We couldn’t think of a better guest to have with us on St Patrick’s Day,” gushed Trump’s press secretary Karoline Leavitt on 17 March, rubbing salt in the wound. McGregor was given access to the Pentagon, met the defence secretary, Pete Hegseth, the health secretary, Robert F Kennedy Jr, and the national security adviser, Mike Waltz. In the Oval Office, McGregor and his family posed for photographs with the US president, a man also found liable for sexual assault. Prominent in the photographs was Elon Musk, the world’s richest individual and Trump’s unelected jobs slasher. McGregor presented Musk with a box of his own brand cigars. Four days later, the Dubliner, self-styled “the notorious”, announced he intends to contest the Irish presidential election later this year.Justine McCarthy is a journalist, author and an Irish Times columnist Continue reading...
title_translated: Trump’s show of support for Conor McGregor is making fertile ground for Ireland’s far right | Justine McCarthy

title: Ancient Egyptian School Found at Mortuary Temple of Ramesses II
description: A joint Egyptian-French archaeological mission, composed of experts from Egypt’s Supreme Council of Antiquities, France’s National Center for Scientific Research, and Sorbonne University, has made some remarkable discoveries at the Ramesseum, the grand mortuary temple of Pharaoh Ramesses II, located on the West Bank of Luxor in the Theban Necropolis. The most notable finds are artifacts showing that the temple was the site of a special type of school known as a Per Ankh, or “House of Life,” where the children of aristocrats were trained to fill roles as government functionaries.Built during the incredibly long and productive reign of Ramesses II (1279 to 1213 BC)—also known as Ramesses the Great—the Ramesseum was much more than a funerary monument. It served as a vibrant center of the New Kingdom’s religious, educational, administrative, and economic life. According to Dr. Mohamed Ismail Khaled, Secretary-General of the Supreme Council of Antiquities, these discoveries are changing the way scholars interpret how the ancient Egyptians lived, worked, and organized their world.Read moreSection: ArtifactsOther ArtifactsNewsHistory & ArchaeologyRead Later
title_translated: Ancient Egyptian School Found at Mortuary Temple of Ramesses II
description_translated: A joint Egyptian-French archaeological mission, composed of experts from Egypt’s Supreme Council of Antiquities, France’s National Center for Scientific Research, and Sorbonne University, has made some remarkable discoveries at the Ramesseum, the grand mortuary temple of Pharaoh Ramesses II, located on the West Bank of Luxor in the Theban Necropolis. The most notable finds are artifacts showing that the temple was the site of a special type of school known as a Per Ankh, or “House of Life,” where the children of aristocrats were trained to fill roles as government functionaries.Built during the incredibly long and productive reign of Ramesses II (1279 to 1213 BC)—also known as Ramesses the Great—the Ramesseum was much more than a funerary monument. It served as a vibrant center of the New Kingdom’s religious, educational, administrative, and economic life. According to Dr. Mohamed Ismail Khaled, Secretary-General of the Supreme Council of Antiquities, these discoveries are changing the way scholars interpret how the ancient Egyptians lived, worked, and organized their world.Read moreSection: ArtifactsOther ArtifactsNewsHistory

title: 애플, 환경 성과 보고서 발표 “2015년 대비 온실가스 60% 감축”
description: 애플은 올해 전 세계에서 발생하는 온실 가스 배출량을 2015년과 비교할 때 60% 이상 감축했다. 애플이 그동안의 성과를 ‘환경 성과 보고서(Environmental Progress Report)를 발표했다.애플이 만드는 아이폰, 아이패드, 맥북, 애플 워치, 에어팟 시리즈 등 휴대하는 모든 제품에는 배터리가 들어가고, 배터리의 핵심 소재 중에 하나가 코발트다. 맥세이프(MagSafe), 에어팟 케이스, 스마트 키보드 폴리오 등에는 자석이 반드시 있어야 하고, 자석 제조에는 희토류 원소가 필요하다.애플 제품의 두뇌에 해당하는 다양한 모델의 애플 실리콘 등 반도체를 생산하는 공정에는 불소화 온실가스(F-CHG)를 배출하는 공정이 포함되어 있다. 불소화 온실 가스는 불소를 함유한 가스로 이산화탄소 보다 지구온난화에 미치는 영향이 더 큰 것으로 알려져 있다.애플의 2025년 목표는 모든 자석에 100% 재활용 희토류 사용과 모든 배터리의 99%에 재활용 코발트 사용인데, 이미 2025년 목표의 99% 이상을 달성했다고 회사는 밝혔다.불소화 온실가스는 애플의 26개 반도체 협력업체 제조 공정에서 배출되는데, 이들 기업은 2030년까지 생산 시설에서 최소 90%를 감축할 계획이다. 애플과 직접 협력관계를 맺고 디스플레이를 생산하는 기업들은 100% 불소화 온실가스를 감축할 것을 약속했다. 2024년의 경우 이들 협력업체에서 줄인 온실가의 배출량은 840만 톤에 달한다.애플과 협력사는 재활용 기술을 활용해 폐기물을 줄이는 ‘제로 폐기물 프로그램’도 진행하고 있다. 2024년에는 약 60만 톤의 매립 폐기물을 줄여, 2015년 이래 총 360만 톤의 매립해야 했던 폐기물이 감소했다. 이를 통해 450만 제곱미터의 매립지를 줄인 것으로 추정된다.무엇 보다 애플 제품을 생산하는 데 필요한 에너지를 2030년까지 100% 재생 가능한 에너지로 전환한다는 목표도 차질 없이 진행되고 있다. 2024년 기준으로 17.8 기가와트의 재생 가능 전력이 글로벌 공급망에서 사용되었고, 이를 통해 2,180만 톤의 온실가스를 줄일 수 있었다. 2023년과 비교하면 17% 이상 증가한 수치다.2013년 시작한 ‘깨끗한 물 프로그램’을 통해서는 900억 갤런 이상의 담수를 절약했다. 2024년에는 이 프로그램에 참여한 협력업체에서 물 재사용 비율이 42%에 달했고, 이를 통해 140억 갤런의 담수를 절약했다. 애플은 2030년까지 수자원 관련 부담이 높은 지역의 담수 사용량을 100% 복원하겠다는 목표를 가지고 있다.애플의 환경, 정책 및 사회 이니셔티브 담당 부사장인 리사 잭슨은 “애플의 모든 사업 부문에 영향을 미치는 Apple 2030을 향해 나아가는 우리의 진전이 매우 자랑스럽다. 오늘날 우리는 그 어느 때보다 많은 청정에너지와 재활용 소재를 사용하고, 전 세계적으로 물을 보존하고 폐기물 발생을 예방하며 자연에 큰 투자를 하고 있다”라고 밝혔다.dl-ciokorea@foundryco.com
title_translated: 애플, 환경 성과 보고서 발표 “2015년 대비 온실가스 60% 감축”

title: Bhavna Pani: 'We make choices as human beings; Amidst the darkness you have a choice to choose hope'
description: A century after the iconic novel first stirred hearts in India, Devdas returns in a blaze of color, music, and emotion: This time dazzling Parisian audiences as a Bollywood musical. Blending timeless storytelling with cinematic flair, the production marks a triumphant return of Indian musical drama to the City of Light. The legendary Grand Rex theatre now hosts this classical tragedy, where the rhythms of Kathak and the spectacle of Bollywood light up the stage. FRANCE 24’s Delano D’Souza welcomes Bhavna Pani, stage director and lead performer, to reflect on this East-meets-West celebration of art and passion.
title_translated: Bhavna Pani: 'We make choices as human beings; Amidst the darkness you have a choice to choose hope'

The legendary Grand Rex theatre now hosts this classical tragedy, where the rhythms of Kathak and the spectacle of Bollywood light up the stage. FRANCE 24’s Delano D’Souza welcomes Bhavna Pani, stage director and lead performer, to reflect on this East-meets-West celebration of art and passion.
